edit.fieldstoshow: Columns to show in participant list:
edit.fieldstohide: Columns to hide in participant list:
edit.contentwhenopen: Content to show when registration is open
edit.contentwhenclosed: Content to show when registration is closed
edit.contentwhennoseats: Content to show when there is no seats available
edit.contentwhenconfirmed: Content to show when registration is confirmed
edit.contentwhensubmitted: Content to show when registration is submitted
edit.emailconfirmtemplate: E-mail to send when registration is confirmed
edit.emailsubmittemplate: E-mail to send when registration is submitted (no seats available)
edit.emailnotificationtemplate: E-mail to send with general information to participants. Triggered manually.
edit.emailcanceltemplate: E-mail to send when registration is cancelled
edit.subject: Subject
edit.saveandsendmail: Save and send e-mail to participant
edit.trackiddescription: Add a track ID to group this session with other sessions with the same ID. User can only choose ONE session from each group. Sessions with same track ID will be grouped together. Leave Track ID empty to group sessions automatically by start time.
edit.deleteconfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete participants. The operation can not be undone.

emailtemplates.title: Scheduled messages help
emailtemplates.content: Message templates can be defined directly on the page, or you can add a reference to a global template created in the block structure.[br][br][strong]Global template[/strong][br]Global templates can be created in the block structure, and must be of the block type [strong]e-mail template[/strong]. Once the template is created, it can be selected by clicking [strong]use global template[/strong]. To make changes to the global template, click [strong]Edit template[/strong]. [br][br][strong]Local template[/strong][br]If the event requires a unique template, it can be edited directly below. If you want to base the template on a global template, but with some adjustments, you can make a local copy of a selected global template by clicking [strong]Made editable copy of template[/strong]. [br][br][strong]Content in the properties[/strong][br]When editing the template, use brackets to refer to properties on the participant, event data, or the event page. Use CurrentRegistration to refer to the participant registration, and CurrentPage to refer to the event page.[br]E.g.: CurrentPage.PageName, CurrentPage.EventStart, Participant.FirstName, Participant.Email.

emailschedule.title: Message scheduling
emailschedule.content: Messages can be sent based on a point in time, or by events in the system. Messages that are scheduled will be sent using the scheduled job, defined in the Episerver admin mode. The event based messages will be sent directly upon the event.

emailtriggers.title: What should trigger the message?
emailtriggers.content: There are three triggers for messages. [ol][li][strong]Specifc[/strong][br]Select specific to send the message in a chosen point in time. For instance October 31st 1985.[/li][li][strong]Relative[/strong][br]Select relative to send the message on a point in time relative to one of the event dates. For instance 2 weeks before event start.[/li][li][strong]Action[/strong][br]Select action to send the message upon a specific event in the system. For instance when a user is cancelling the participation.[/li][/ol]

emailwhen.title: When should the message be sent?
emailwhen.content: Which properties to populate here is dependent on the trigger chosen. Specify the exact time the message should be sent. Note: The scheduled job Attend Send Scheduled Email must be activated in the admin mode for the messages to be sent.

emailfilter.title: Status filter
emailfilter.content: Add a filter to ensure only the users with the specified statuses recieves the message. Select all the status users could have in order to get the message. If confirmed and submitted is selected, the cancelled participants will not recieve the message when it is being sent.

participantslist.title: Participants
participantslist.content: The list shows all participants associated to the event. Above the table, it is possible to filter the list based on status, e-mail, sessions. There is also a free text serach for participants. The export button below the table will create an Excel workbook with the same filters applied.[br][br][strong]Select participants[/strong][br]Select participants by clicking the checkbox symbol on the far left side of the table. You can select participants from multiple events. When participants are chosen, a new button row will appear above the table.
